context: I am a different person than I used to be. I used to be heavyset but I lost weight. I took up swimming and lost the weight. I worked out three times week and ate healthy every day.
choices: I am much healthier now.

choices: Jane's girlfriend was a die-hard flower lover.

context: Damon lost his wallet with his ID in it. He searched all over the house. He couldn't find it anywhere. He eventually just went and got a replacement ID.
choices: Damon went straight to his room and went to bed.

context: Bob was going to take his daughter to see Grandma. The two drove to Grandma's house a few miles down the street. Grandma welcomed them with open arms. The 3 of them had a big dinner at night.
choices: Bob's daughter thanked Grandma for the delicious meal.

context: Sue's cat was nowhere to be seen. Sue searched for her cat for hours until she heard purring outside. Her cat was stuck in the tree. Sue called up the fire department.
choices: Suzi hoped the cat would stay in the tree.

context: Ava brought home a catfish. She put it into her tank. She wasn't sure how the other fish would react. She watched apprehensively.
choices: Ava flushed all the aquarium water down the toilet.

context: I bought a new car today. It is shiny and red. The inside smells so fresh and clean. I love the car so much.
choices: I decided to get rid of the car.

context: Teresa was an artist. She made a beautiful sculpture of an angel. She entered it into an art contest. The judges liked the sculpture very much.
choices: She won the contest and was proud of herself.

context: My dog waited for me by the house front door. We walked to the park for playtime and exercise. The dog and I walked around the block before returning home. When we walked through the front door, she took a big drink of water.
choices: Then she lay down and took a nap.

context: Matt found a puppy wandering down the street. It looked lost and scared, so Matt took it home. Matt's mom called some neighbors, and eventually found its owner. The puppy's owner was so relieved to know his puppy was safe!
choices: The puppy's owner gave Matt a reward for finding it.
The puppy's owner strangled it and offered Matt the corpse.

context: Mike bought a new bike to ride in his town. He cycled from his house to a friend's house. On the way he met a group of kids riding bikes as well. Neiter Mike nor the kids were wearing helmets at the time.
choices: Mike didn't like riding bikes.

context: Lucy placed a pan of food into the oven. She set a timer and sat down to watch television. After awhile, she smelled smoke. Quickly, she checked the timer and realized it never went off.

context: Tim's history class was first thing in the morning. He arrived to class very tired. He started to nod off. When he woke up, class was almost over.

context: Doug and Molly decided to go the park to take a walk. While they were there they found a stray dog. They carried the dog back to their apartment. They posted an ad online to try to find the owner.

context: Bill's father told him to keep practicing his piano scales. He was an expert pianist, and wanted the same for his son. Bill was too young to understand the value of practice. He bitterly sat at the piano, playing his scales over and over.
choices: Bill was happy to practice every day.

context: Lance wanted to have a romantic evening with his wife. He put the kids to bed early and started dinner. He forgot to check the cooking and burned down the kitchen. His wife arrived to the fire department.
choices: Lance's wife felt very romantic and loving when she arrived home.

context: Maria wanted to learn Spanish. She decided to fully immerse herself in it. She bought a one way ticket to Spain. After six months, Maria could speak fluent Spanish.
choices: Leah forgot how to speak Spanish.

context: Julie had a pretty pink ball that she loved to bounce outside. One day, it bounced too far and went into the street. It rolled down the hill and over the curb. It then rolled into the creek.

choices: Carl decided to give the bike to his son.

context: Kim had eaten deer meat without knowing what type of meat it was. She found the thought disgusting. She ran to the bathroom as she gagged. By the time she reached the bathroom the gagging had subsided.

context: Carl looked into a telescope for the first time at 9-Year's-old. He was immediately breath-taken and full of wonder. He decided he had to learn more about the cosmos. He studied science and astronomy through high school and college.

context: Julie had a coworker named Barry who loved to make trouble for others. Barry told Julie, who was new, that she should dress up for Halloween. Julie, who was naive, came to work dressed as a cat on Halloween. She was the only one in costume!

context: I was riding my bike to work one summer morning. I was a little late, so I was in a hurry. I was biking a little recklessly. To my dismay, my reckless biking caused me to get in an accident.

context: Gina whispered to Mary in detention. The girls giggled together. Gina could tell the teacher wasn't pleased. They continued to whisper.
choices: The teacher told them to stop talking.

context: The cop pulled me over at night. He said I had been speeding. He went back to his car. I waited with the lights flashing behind me.

context: Sandra had always wished for a pet turtle. She told her parents she would be responsible for it. At first her parents didn't agree. Eventually Sandra convinced her parents she should get a turtle.

context: A group of children played marbles one afternoon. Or at least, they tried to. There was a great deal of arguing. Ultimately, they gave up and played something else.

context: Han and Leia once fought in a great battle together. Leia's brother also fought with them. They were all heros. Many Year's later, Han and Leia had a child.
